text: Bottle Squad with a boom we are ready to zoom
Bottle Squad!
Bottle Squad ! Be strong,
Be brave,
Be smart,
Be kind
Solving problems we don’t mind!
We are the closest friends you’ll ever find.
Bottle Squad
Ba Ba Bottle Squad

Ben:
“Yeesh! It’s cold!
I can’t wait to get back home!”

Bethany:
Good idea, Barkie.
Let’s go in and see if the sheep will have some spare wool to give us to keep us warm.
Baa Baa Black sheep have you any wool?
Yes sir, yes sir, three bags full!
One for my master,
One for my dame,
And one for the little boy who lives down the lane.

Ben:
“So do you have any for me?
Awh!”
Baa Baa white sheep have you any wool?
No sir no sir not even a handful.
None for my King,
And None for my queen,
None for the little bird who loves to sing.

BEN:
“I bet that sheep is as cold as I am!
We need to help him find some wool!”

Bethany:
“Looks like Barkie has found another sheep.
Let’s go check”
Baa baa blue sheep have you any wool?
Yes sir yes sir lots of bags full!
For Jack and Jill
& Polly & Johnny
One for the whole farm and one for all of you!

Ben:
“Oh, do you think you could spare some wool for the white sheep?”

Becca:
“But wait! This wool is BLUE!
We need white wool!”

Bethany: 
“I have an idea!
"Follow me”

Becca:
“Wow! The blue washes right out!”

Blake:
“I don’t think that the sheep will want these all wet like this…”

Bethany:
“What if we hold the bags in front of the windmill?
It’s a windy day today!
We should be able to make dry them like that!”

Ben: 
“That’s a great idea!
Ba ba boom We’re ready to ZOOOM!”

Bethany:
“Everybody ready?

Becca:
“Guys! It’s working!”

Ben:
“Awesome! Let’s get this bag to the white sheep!”

Ben:
“Hey little guy, we brought you something.”
"Wow! Thank you! thank you! THANK YOU!”
Baa Baa white sheep have you any wool?
Yes sir yes sir 3 bags full.
One for my King,
And One for his queen,
And one for the little bird who loves to sing.

"If you need our help, you can count on us!
That’s our Ba-Ba Promise to you!"

Ben:
“Guys, lets go and get our bags of wool before we catch a chill”
